info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 3:24PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 321 PM MDT, a broken line of strong thunderstorms was beginning to take shape across Sierra County. The strongest storm was located just east of Hillsboro, and in the high terrain on the east shores of Elephant Butte Reservoir. Eventually outflow from these storms will push southeast, generating new thunderstorm development in the Rincon Valley, and across the Jornada del Muerto, both north of Hatch.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Upham, Arrey, Caballo, Truth or Consequences, Hillsboro, Derry, Salem, Lake Valley, Garfield, Engle, Kingston, Cutter, Palomas, City of Elephant Butte, Spaceport America, Rock House, Ladder Ranch, Williamsburg, Alamosa Canyon, and Lower Palomas Canyon.
This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 44 and 82.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
